I would give this response a grade of 85.

The response accurately conveys that Islam does not view Jesus as the literal "Son of God" in the same sense as Christianity, due to the Islamic emphasis on the oneness of God (Tawhid). It also correctly identifies the Christian concept of the Son of God as referring to Jesus' unique relationship with God. Additionally, the response shows an understanding of Islam's view of Jesus as a prophet and messenger of God.

However, the response could have delved deeper into the concern about understanding the divinity of Jesus and His eternal relationship with God. While it mentions that Christians believe Jesus is fully God and shares the same nature as God the Father, it does not provide further explanation or exploration of this concept. A higher grade would require a more in-depth examination of this concern.
